item.title: 亚洲股市将搭乘华尔街乐观主义的顺风车：市场综述
item.description: 本周亚洲股市有望收高，此前科技股反弹推动华尔街创下历史新高。在唐纳德-特朗普总统敦促欧佩克降低原油价格并表示将推动减息之后，石油价格下跌。【原文：Asian equities were on track to close the week higher, following a rebound in technology stocks that pushed Wall Street to a record high. Oil fell after President Donald Trump urged OPEC to lower crude prices and said he will push for interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 迪斯尼将艾格的薪酬提高 30%，以反映利润的好转
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司（Walt Disney Co.）将首席执行官鲍勃-艾格（Bob Iger）在 2024 财年的薪酬总额提高了 30%，突显了他对这家媒体和娱乐公司的扭转。【原文：Walt Disney Co. boosted Chief Executive Officer Bob Iger’s total pay by 30% in fiscal 2024, underscoring his turnaround of the media and entertainment company.】

item.title: 波音公司杰普逊部门吸引航空航天和收购者
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，在下周第一轮竞标截止日期到来之前，波音公司可能出售其捷普森导航部门的计划正吸引着主要航空供应商和私募股权收购者。【原文：Boeing Co.’s potential sale of its Jeppesen navigation unit is attracting major aviation suppliers and private equity suitors ahead of the deadline for first-round bids next week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 风暴过后力拓第一季度铁矿石出口量下降
item.description: 澳大利亚西北部的热带气旋破坏了一个港口设施，力拓集团警告本季度的铁矿石运输将受到影响。【原文：Rio Tinto Group warned shipments of iron ore will be impacted this quarter after a tropical cyclone in Australia’s northwest damaged a port facility.】

item.title: 道明银行洗钱部主管马扎里戈斯离职，桑朱阿斯升职
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）正在提拔其美国反洗钱部门的一名高级管理人员杰奎琳-桑朱亚斯（Jacqueline Sanjuas），让她负责整个银行的金融犯罪风险管理。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank is promoting one of its top US anti-money-laundering executives, Jacqueline Sanjuas, to a role that will see her head up financial crime risk management for the entire bank.】

item.title: 中洋集团押注高风险抵押贷款债务，2024 年回报率高达 25
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一封致投资者的信，MidOcean Credit Partners 在 2024 年对其抵押贷款债务中风险最高部分的投资回报率高达 25%。【原文：MidOcean Credit Partners’ investment in the riskiest part of its own collateralized loan obligations returned as much as 25% in 2024, according to a letter to investors seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: Substack 启动 2,000 万美元基金吸引 TikTok 的创作者
item.description: 深受独立作家欢迎的时事通讯平台 Substack Inc. 正在发起一项 2,000 万美元的基金，以吸引 TikTok 和其他社交媒体上的创作者。【原文：Substack Inc., the newsletter platform popular with independent writers, is launching a $20 million fund to lure creators from TikTok and other social-media outlets.】

item.title: 亿万富翁安巴尼计划在印度建立全球最大的数据中心
item.description: 穆克什-安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）的信实集团（Reliance Group）正在印度建设一个按容量计算可能成为世界上最大的数据中心，这是为利用人工智能服务的蓬勃需求而进行的全球投资的最新举措。【原文：Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Group is building what may become the world’s biggest data center by capacity in India, the latest in a blitz of global investments to capitalize on booming demand for artificial intelligence services.】

item.title: 美国财政部采取新措施避免债务上限崩溃
item.description: 美国财政部表示，它正在扩大使用特别会计措施，以避免突破本月早些时候重新生效的联邦债务限额。【原文：The US Treasury said it’s expanding its use of special accounting measures to avert breaching the federal debt limit, which kicked back in earlier this month.】

item.title: 收购交易失败后，Einhorn 加倍看好手袋制造商 Capri
item.description: 今年 10 月，当美国法官出人意料地阻止卡普里控股有限公司（Capri Holdings Ltd.）对竞争对手 Tapestry 公司（Tapestry Inc.对于亿万富翁大卫-艾因霍恩（David Einhorn）的绿光资本（Greenlight Capital）来说，这是一个加倍下注的机会。【原文：When a US judge unexpectedly blocked Capri Holdings Ltd.’s takeover by rival Tapestry Inc. in October, stunned hedge fund managers ran for the exits as the handbag maker’s stock plunged. For billionaire David Einhorn’s Greenlight Capital, it was a chance to double down.】

item.title: 卡马拉-哈里斯的播客策略远不及特朗普
item.description:
她在YouTube传播节目中的竞选露面获得了680万次观看。特朗普的浏览量则高达 1.136 亿次。【原文：

Her campaign appearances on YouTube-distributed shows received 6.8 million views. Trump’s added up to 113.6 million.

item.title: 呼吁 "冷静 "引导世界关注特朗普的关税言论
item.description: 本周，达沃斯论坛上全球保护主义抬头，世界上最引人注目的自由贸易倡导者提出了一些建议。【原文：The world’s most visible champion of free trade offered some advice at Davos, where rising global protectionism was on everyone’s mind this week.】

item.title: 亨氏生产商抨击特鲁多将番茄酱作为贸易目标
item.description: 卡夫亨氏公司（Kraft Heinz Co.）表示，在加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）在讨论与美国的贸易关系时向这家食品制造商扔了一个比喻性的西红柿之后，该公司对特鲁多 "深感失望"。【原文：Kraft Heinz Co. said it’s “deeply disappointed” in Justin Trudeau after the Canadian prime minister threw a metaphorical tomato at the food manufacturer while discussing trade relations with the US.】

item.title: 高盛击败好莱坞经理人就 70 亿美元交易提起的诉讼
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.）驳回了一家好莱坞管理公司的诉讼，该公司声称自己在一项价值 70 亿美元的私募股权交易中受到误导，从而破坏了自己的收购市场。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. won dismissal of a Hollywood management firm’s lawsuit claiming it was misled about a $7 billion private equity deal that allegedly spoiled the market for its own bid to be acquired.】

item.title: 德州仪器预测显示芯片市场持续低迷
item.description: 德州仪器公司（Texas Instruments Inc.【原文：Texas Instruments Inc. gave a disappointing earnings forecast for the current period, a sign it’s contending with still-sluggish chip demand and higher costs tied to a factory expansion.】

item.title: 罕见的欧元债券标志着日本保险公司今年的强劲开局
item.description: 日本人寿保险公司（Nippon Life Insurance Co., Ltd.）售出了日本寿险公司罕见的欧元债券，因为日本寿险业看来将加强海外债务销售，以遵守新的资本法规，并为海外并购获得资金。【原文：Nippon Life Insurance Co. sold a rare euro bond by a Japanese life insurer as the sector looks set to boost debt sales abroad to comply with new capital regulations and to secure funds for overseas mergers and acquisitions.】

item.title: 特朗普吹捧的千亿美元人工智能 "星际之门 "项目将利用太阳能发电
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统宣称将加速美国人工智能发展的千亿美元风险投资，预计将部分依赖于其关注气候问题的前任所青睐的动力来源— 太阳能和电池。【原文：A $100 billion venture that President Donald Trump heralds as accelerating artificial intelligence in the US is expected to depend in part on power sources favored by his climate-focused predecessor — solar and batteries.】

item.title: 特朗普签署加密货币行政法案后，比特币走高
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统签署了与加密货币和人工智能有关的行政措施后，比特币小幅走高。【原文：Bitcoin edged marginally higher after President Donald Trump signed executive actions related to cryptocurrency and artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 阿根廷削减出口税以挽救受干旱影响的收成
item.description: 阿根廷削减了为其提供数十亿美元出口收入的主要农作物的税收，试图向与干旱和全球低价搏斗的农民施以援手。【原文：Argentina slashed taxes on its major crops that provide billions of dollars in export revenue as it seeks to throw a lifeline to farmers wrestling with a drought a low global prices.】

item.title: 阿根廷干旱迫使交易所下调大豆和玉米产量预测
item.description: 阿根廷的干旱正在侵蚀该国最重要的农作物。【原文：A drought in Argentina is eating into the country’s most important crops.】

item.description:

item.title: Vsquare 报道：库什纳的亲信将加入匈牙利的 "迷你迪拜
item.description: Vsquare 援引一位接近维克托-欧尔班总理政府的消息人士的话报道称，贾里德-库什纳的 Affinity Partners 可能会加入阿布扎比开发商 Eagle Hills 在匈牙利的项目。【原文：Jared Kushner’s Affinity Partners could join Abu Dhabi-based developer Eagle Hills’ project in Hungary, Vsquare reported, citing a source close to Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government.】

item.title: 芝加哥学校从循环信贷中获得 4 亿美元预付款
item.description: 作为与美国银行和 PNC 银行签订的短期循环信贷协议的一部分，芝加哥教育委员会本月首次预支了 4 亿美元。【原文：The Chicago Board of Education took an initial advance of $400 million this month as part of its short-term revolving credit agreements with Bank of America and PNC Bank.】

item.title: 阿根廷 11 月经济增长超预期
item.description: 阿根廷经济 11 月份的增长超过预期，在第三季度超过增长预期后继续显示出复苏迹象。【原文：Argentina’s economy expanded more than expected in November, continuing to show signs of recovery after surpassing growth forecasts in the third quarter.】

item.title: 巴西酝酿大型食品折扣网络以提升卢拉的人气
item.description: 巴西政府正在权衡各种措施，例如通过商店网络提供减价食品，以抗击通货膨胀，提高总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦的声望。【原文：Brazil’s government is weighing measures such as providing reduced-cost food products through a network of stores in an attempt to combat inflation and boost President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s popularity.】

item.title: 页岩推动阿根廷实现 2006 年以来最大能源贸易顺差
item.description: 得益于阿根廷瓦卡穆埃尔塔页岩区蓬勃发展的石油和天然气生产，阿根廷在 2024 年实现了近二十年来最大规模的年度能源贸易顺差。预计今年的情况会更好。【原文：Argentina scored its widest annual energy trade surplus in nearly two decades in 2024 thanks to booming oil and gas production in the country’s Vaca Muerta shale patch. It’s forecast to do even better this year.】

item.title: 巴西部长称特朗普退出巴黎会议将推动投资者移居海外
item.description: 巴西能源部长表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布美国退出具有里程碑意义的《巴黎协定》，为将数十亿美元的投资引向包括巴西在内的其他经济体打开了空间。【原文：President Donald Trump’s withdrawal of the US from the landmark Paris Agreement opens room to drive billions of dollars in investment to other economies including Brazil, according to its energy minister.】
